newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazilian police kill armed man in TV shootout.
newsitem.headline: Brazilian police kill armed man in TV shootout.

text.p: Sao Paulo police shot and killed a man on Saturday after rappelling into his apartment during an armed stand-off later shown on Globo television.
Globo played an amateur videotape showing Oswaldo Manoel da Silva, 29, a pistol in each hand, smashing a window and shouting at police: "I'll be dead if I come down."
The stand-off, which began after a violent domestic argument, ended when three officers rappelled onto da Silva's balcony, dragged him to the floor and then into the apartment.
Shots were heard inside the apartment. Da Silva was put in the back of a police van and pronounced dead on arrival at a hospital, Globo reported.
A police officer in charge of the operation later told the television station "(Da Silva) pulled out his weapons and shot at the team. The team fired back. That was all that happened."
Da Silva's wife, Maria Carmo dos Santos, said her husband had been taking drugs after his two motorcycle showrooms ran into financial difficulties.
